messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Sharing food ideaas
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/18/2004 8:08:45 AM Mountain Standard Time, Earthmomma67@aol.com writes: Or make mini cakes, like a restaurant! Or single layer cakes. For
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/18/2004 8:08:45 AM Mountain Standard Time,
Earthmomma67@... writes:
Or make mini cakes, like a restaurant!
Or single layer cakes.

For real birthday cakes, I work from scratch, but sometimes when cake mixes
are on sale for $1 I'll get some, make one in a bundt-cake pan and just leave
it out, unfrosted, for people to eat or not. Cheap, filling, not sugar-coated.
Good with ice cream. Good with tea.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Sharing food ideaas
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/17/2004 9:21:55 PM Eastern Standard Time, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes: Though I guess I could slice up the cake before
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/17/2004 9:21:55 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
Though I guess I could slice up the cake before putting it in the
freezer to make easier access.

Sherilyn
Or make mini cakes, like a restaurant!
Elissa
Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you;
They're supposed to help you discover who you are.
~Bernice Johnson Reagon
